result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hasheem S. Amin

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Violation Report

No contact directly or indirectly with victim D.L.P., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere except for one time trip with law enforcement for personal belongings. No possession of any weapons. No acts or threats of violence towards anyone including L.P. Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. GPS monitoring. Must take all psychotropic medication as prescribed.

3:28 PM Defendant Hasheem S. Amin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Philip J. Brehm appeared by video for Hasheem S. Amin.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads not guilty. Warrant vacated. Cash bond set of $500 with previously ordered conditions.
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
